text: Watch: Ward boy breaks 3-day-old baby's leg Web Report /India Filed on February 7, 2017 Share More > Vote The fractured leg of the baby was detected after the child was admitted to a hospital in Dehradun A hospital ward boy allegedly broke the leg of a three-day-old baby in Uttarakhand, India. According to the NDTV, the attendant got angry over the crying of the baby who was admitted in the hospital due to respiratory problems. Man tries to set himself alight at Makkah Grand Mosque The incident has been caught on the CCTV. The footage shows the man in the room where baby is kept under observation. When the baby starts crying, he walks to the infant, pulls his leg brutally to change the diaper. He then continues with his work. Arab man becomes father at 92 The fractured leg of the baby was detected after the child was admitted to a hospital in Dehradun. "My baby was tortured all night by the attendant and he also broke his leg,"the father of the three-year-old was quoted saying. Police have assured that action will be taken against the accused.
